intro: Heptapleurum tripteris, commonly known as the broadleaf holly, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are thick, leathery, and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Heptapleurum tripteris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
